title: Keen 4 on XP
content:
Hi guys I'm new here and I'm sure youve been asked questions about running keen on XP before. Ive tried running ck4 on dos, ive downloaded emulators like DOSBox, and Ive fiddled about with memory and stuff like that on my computer. However, every time I run commander keen 4 and above the screen flickers horribly. I have tried using the screen flicker and VGA thing on the in game options but it still flickers! I really hope someone on this forum can help me out and I hope I can become part of the keen community.

Cheers

Mike

title: Progress... but at what cost?
content:
It does the same thing on my 'more modern' computers. It's to do with the graphics card rather than XP itself. If you booted to pure DOS I doubt the results would be any better.

In fact it tends to happen on some old 2Mb onboard adapters. Just something they don't like about ModeX.

Ultimately, either DOSbox or a Keen-O-Matic are the best solutions. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

title: Re: Keen 4 on XP
content:
1.4 is the latest version of Keen 4, but you said you've already tried the fix jerky motion (which is only in version 1.4, IIRK) so your version probably isn't the problem.

I just checked Keen 4 in DOSBox on the XP computer I'm using at the moment, and I have the same problem. Lowering the cpu cycles seems to reduce the amount of jerkiness, though. Try setting it to something like 800.--------------

title: Re: Keen 4 on XP
content: Thanks for your help guys. What is Keen-O-Matic and where can I get it? Also, how can I lower the cpu cycles on DOSBox?

title: Re: Keen 4 on XP
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]What is Keen-O-Matic and where can I get it?[hr][/quote]
"Keen-o-matic" is Keen community slang for an ancient PC with a slow processor and an old graphics chipset. You might be able to find one at a yard sale or on eBay for a few dollars.
[quote]Quote:[hr]Also, how can I lower the cpu cycles on DOSBox?[hr][/quote]
DOSBox comes with a manual containing instructions on how to do this. AFAIK, you can find it on DOSBox's start menu entry.[url=http://last.fm/users/grafix5000/][img]http://toxicsheep.com/sigs/scrobbler.png[/img][/url]
